ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Nor is it the word of an accursed Shaytan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: This is not the utterance of an accursed devil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: nor is it a word of an accursed Satan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Quran is not the word of condemned satan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the Qur’an is not the recitation of Satan the outcast.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And it is not the word of the outcast Shaytan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nor is it the word of the cursed Shaitan,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And it is not the word of an accursed Satan;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nor is this the utterance of a devil worthy to be stoned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Nor is this the word of an outcast devil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nor is it the word of a Satan accursed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And it is not the speech of an outcast Satan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor is it the word of an evil spirit accursed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And it (the Quran) is not the word of the outcast Shaitan (Satan).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Nor is this the word of a stoned satan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And it is not the word of an accursed devil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the Qur'an is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:25] And it, that is, the Qur’ān, is not the word of an accursed satan, eavesdropping stealthily.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nor is this) i.e. the Qur'an (the utterance of a devil worthy to be stoned) the utterance of an accursed, rebellious devil whose name is al-Marmi.
